sen.j: 佐賀の七賢人（さがのしちけんじん）は、江戸時代末期（幕末）から明治時代にかけて活躍した、佐賀藩（今の佐賀県）出身の偉人七人の総称である。
sen.e: Seven wise men in Saga was a general name of seven great men of Saga, who made remarkable services in the end of Edo Period (the last days of Tokugawa Shogunate) to Meiji period.
Seven wise men in Saga was a general name of seven great men of Saga, who made remarkable services in the end of Edo Period (the last days of Tokugawa Shogunate) to Meiji period.
Seven wise men in Saga was a general name of seven great men of Saga, who made remarkable services in the end of Edo Period (the last days of Tokugawa Shogunate) to Meiji period.

sen.j: 並びは五十音順。
sen.e: Introductions are in Japanese alphabetical order (of surname).
Introductions are in Japanese alphabetical order (of surname).
Introductions are in Japanese alphabetical order (of surname).

sen.j: 江藤新平
sen.e: Shinpei ETO
Shinpei ETO
Shinpei ETO

sen.j: 1834年佐賀郡八戸村（今の佐賀市八戸町）に生まれる。
sen.e: He was born in Hachinohe Village, Saga County (present Hachinohe-cho, Saga City) in 1834.
He was born in Hachinohe Village, Saga County (present Hachinohe-cho, Saga City) in 1834.
He was born in Hachinohe Village, Saga County (present Hachinohe-cho, Saga City) in 1834.

sen.j: 1871年に廃藩置県を行う。
sen.e: He practiced Haihan-chiken (abolition of feudal domains and establishment of prefectures) in 1871.
He practiced Haihan-chiken (abolition of feudal domains and establishment of prefectures) in 1871.
He practiced Haihan-chiken (abolition of feudal domains and establishment of prefectures) in 1871.

sen.j: 1872年に法務大臣、1873年には参議に就任。
sen.e: He took office as the Minister of Justice in 1872 and was appointed to Sangi (councilor) in 1873.
He took office as the Minister of Justice in 1872 and was appointed to Sangi (councilor) in 1873.
He took office as the Minister of Justice in 1872 and was appointed to Sangi (councilor) in 1873.

sen.j: 1874年佐賀の乱で敗れ、刑死。
sen.e: In 1874, he lost in Saga War and executed.
In 1874, he lost in Saga War and was executed.
In 1874, he lost in Saga War and was executed.

sen.j: 大木喬任
sen.e: Takato OKI
Takato OKI
Takato OKI

sen.j: 1832年今の佐賀市水ケ江に生まれる。
sen.e: He was born in present Mizugae, Saga City in 1832.
He was born in present Mizugae, Saga City in 1832.
He was born in present Mizugae, Saga City in 1832.

sen.j: 1868年に東京府知事、1871年に初代文部大臣、1873年に参議、司法卿、1880年に元老院 (日本)議長に就任。
sen.e: He took offices as the Governor of Tokyo Prefecture in 1868, the first Minister of Education in 1871, Sangi and Shihokyo (administrator of Ministry of Justice) in 1873, and the chairman of Genroin (the Chamber of Elders) (Japan) in 1880.

He took offices as the Governor of Tokyo Prefecture in 1868, the first Minister of Education in 1871, Sangi and Shihokyo (administrator of Ministry of Justice) in 1873, and the chairman of Genroin (the Chamber of Elders) (Japan) in 1880.

He took offices as the Governor of Tokyo Prefecture in 1868, the first Minister of Education in 1871, Sangi and Shihokyo (administrator of Ministry of Justice) in 1873, and the chairman of Genroin (the Chamber of Elders) (Japan) in 1880.

sen.j: 1899年に死去。
sen.e: He died in 1899.
He died in 1899.
He died in 1899.

sen.j: 大隈重信
sen.e: Shigenobu OKUMA
Shigenobu OKUMA
Shigenobu OKUMA

sen.j: 1838年、今の佐賀市水ケ江に生まれる。
sen.e: He was born in the present Mizugae, Saga City in 1838.
sen.cmt: 記入する欄がずれていたので修正しました。
sen.e: He was born in the present Mizugae, Saga City in 1838.

sen.j: 1870年、参議、1873年、参議兼大蔵大臣になる。
sen.e: He was born in present Mizugae, Saga City in 1838.
He became Sangi (councillor) in 1870 and Sangi cum Minister of Treasury in 1873.
sen.cmt: 訳し漏れですので補足しました。
sen.e: He became Sangi (councillor) in 1870 and Sangi cum Minister of Treasury in 1873.

sen.j: 1882年3月、立憲改進党結成。
sen.e: He formed the Constitutional Progressive Party in March 1882.
He formed the Constitutional Progressive Party in March 1882.
He formed the Constitutional Progressive Party in March 1882.

sen.j: 同年10月、東京専門学校（現在の早稲田大学）を開校。
sen.e: In October 1882, he founded Tokyo Senmon Gakko (present Waseda University).
In October 1882, he founded Tokyo Senmon Gakko (present Waseda University).
In October 1882, he founded Tokyo Senmon Gakko (present Waseda University).

sen.j: 1888年、外務大臣、1898年、内閣総理大臣（第1次大隈内閣）。
sen.e: In 1888, he took office as the Minister of Foreign Affairs and was appointed to the Prime Minister (the first Okuma Cabinet).
In 1888, he took office as the Minister of Foreign Affairs and was appointed the Prime Minister in 1898 (the first Okuma Cabinet).
sen.cmt: 訳し漏れと文法を修正しました。
sen.e: In 1888, he took office as the Minister of Foreign Affairs and was appointed the Prime Minister in 1898 (the first Okuma Cabinet).

sen.j: 1914年、二度目の内閣総理大臣（第2次大隈内閣）。
sen.e: In 1914, he was appointed to the Prime Minister for the second time (the second Okuma Cabinet).
In 1914, he was appointed the Prime Minister for the second time (the second Okuma Cabinet).
In 1914, he was appointed the Prime Minister for the second time (the second Okuma Cabinet).

sen.j: 1922年死去、国葬。
sen.e: He died in 1922, and he was given a national funeral.
He died in 1922, and he was given a national funeral.
He died in 1922, and he was given a national funeral.

sen.j: 佐野常民
sen.e: Tsunetami SANO
Tsunetami SANO
Tsunetami SANO

sen.j: 1822年に今の佐賀市川副町に生まれる。
sen.e: He was born in present Kawasoe-machi Saga City in 1822.
He was born in the present Kawasoe-machi, Saga City in 1822.
He was born in the present Kawasoe-machi, Saga City in 1822.

sen.j: 1855年に日本初の蒸気機関車模型を完成させる。
sen.e: He accomplished the first Japanese steam locomotive in 1855.
He accomplished the first Japanese steam locomotive model in 1855.
sen.cmt: 訳し漏れを補足しました。
sen.e: He accomplished the first Japanese steam locomotive model in 1855.

sen.j: 1867年にパリ万国博覧会 (1867年)にて赤十字社について知る。
sen.e: He learnt about Red Cross Society in the Paris World Exposition in 1867.
sen.cmt: 「1867年」と2度出てきているので、訳ではあわせてひとつ省きました。
sen.e: He learnt about Red Cross Society in the Paris World Exposition in 1867.
He learnt about Red Cross Society in the Paris World Exposition in 1867.

sen.j: 1877年に大給恒らと博愛社を創設。
sen.e: In 1877, he founded Hakuaisha (an organization founded in Seinan War and aimed for aids of the wounded, later Japanese Red Cross Society) with Yuzuru OGYU.
In 1877, he founded Hakuaisha (an organization founded during Seinan War and aimed for aids of the wounded, later Japanese Red Cross Society) with Yuzuru OGYU.
In 1877, he founded Hakuaisha (an organization founded during Seinan War and aimed for aids of the wounded, later Japanese Red Cross Society) with Yuzuru OGYU.

sen.j: 1880年大蔵卿に就任。
sen.e: In 1880, he took office as Okura-kyo (Minister of the Treasury).
In 1880, he took office as Okura-kyo (Minister of the Treasury).
In 1880, he took office as Okura-kyo (Minister of the Treasury).

sen.j: 1887年に博愛社を日本赤十字社と改める。
sen.e: In 1887, he changed the name of Hakuaisha to Japanese Red Cross Society.
In 1887, he changed the name of Hakuaisha to Japanese Red Cross Society.
In 1887, he changed the name of Hakuaisha to Japanese Red Cross Society.
He died in 1902.
He died in 1902.
He died in 1902.

sen.j: 島義勇
sen.e: Yoshitake SHIMA
Yoshitake SHIMA
Yoshitake SHIMA

sen.j: 1822年に今の佐賀市に生まれる。
sen.e: He was born in present Saga City in 1822.
He was born in the present Saga City in 1822.
He was born in the present Saga City in 1822.

sen.j: 1856年～1857年に北海道と樺太を探検・調査。
sen.e: From 1856 to 1857, he explored and researched in Hokkaido and Sakhalin.
From 1856 to 1857, he explored and researched in Hokkaido and Sakhalin.
From 1856 to 1857, he explored and researched in Hokkaido and Sakhalin.

sen.j: 1869年に北海道開拓使主席判官に就任し、札幌市のまちづくりの指揮をとる。
sen.e: In 1869, he was appointed to a chief judge of Hokkaido Development Commissioner, and took charge of the boosting local development in Sapporo City.
In 1869, he was appointed a chief judge of Hokkaido Development Commissioner, and took charge of the boosting local development in Sapporo City.
sen.cmt: 文法を修正しました。（appointの語法）
sen.e: In 1869, he was appointed a chief judge of Hokkaido Development Commissioner, and took charge of the boosting local development in Sapporo City.

sen.j: 1871年に秋田県令（現在の秋田県知事）に就任。
sen.e: In 1871, he was appointed to Akita Kenrei (present Akita prefectural governor).
In 1871, he was appointed Akita Kenrei (the present Akita Prefectural Governor).
In 1871, he was appointed Akita Kenrei (the present Akita Prefectural Governor).

sen.j: 1874年に佐賀の乱で敗れ、刑死。
sen.e: In 1874, he lost in Saga War and was executed.
In 1874, he lost in Saga War and was executed.
In 1874, he lost in Saga War and was executed.

sen.j: 副島種臣
sen.e: Taneomi SOEJIMA
Taneomi SOEJIMA
Taneomi SOEJIMA

sen.j: 1828年に今の佐賀市に生まれる。
sen.e: He was born in present Saga City in 1828.
He was born in the present Saga City in 1828.
He was born in the present Saga City in 1828.

sen.j: 1869年に参議、1871年に外務大臣、1892年に内務大臣 (日本)に就任。
sen.e: He took offices as Sangi in 1869, the Minister of Foreign Affairs in 1871, and Minister of Home Affairs (Japan) in 1892.
He took offices as Sangi in 1869, the Minister of Foreign Affairs in 1871, and Minister of Home Affairs (Japan) in 1892.
He took offices as Sangi in 1869, the Minister of Foreign Affairs in 1871, and Minister of Home Affairs (Japan) in 1892.
He died in 1905.
He died in 1905.
He died in 1905.

sen.j: 鍋島直正（閑叟）
sen.e: Naomasa NABESHIMA
Naomasa NABESHIMA
Naomasa NABESHIMA

sen.j: 1814年に佐賀藩九代藩主鍋島斉直の子として、江戸に生まれる。
sen.e: He was born in Edo in 1814, as a child of Narinao NABESHIMA who was the ninth lord of the Saga Domain.
He was born in Edo in 1814, as a child of Narinao NABESHIMA who was the ninth lord of the Saga Domain.
He was born in Edo in 1814, as a child of Narinao NABESHIMA who was the ninth lord of the Saga Domain.

sen.j: 1830年に佐賀藩の第十代藩主となる。
sen.e: In 1830, he became the tenth lord of the Saga Domain.
In 1830, he became the tenth lord of the Saga Domain.
In 1830, he became the tenth lord of the Saga Domain.

sen.j: 武雄領主鍋島茂義の影響を受け開明政策を採用し、1834年に佐賀城下に医学館を建てる。
sen.e: Influenced by Shigeyoshi NABESHIMA, the feudal lord of Takeo, he adapted kaimei (enlightenment) policy and in 1834, he founded Igakukan (medical school) in castle town of Saga-jo Castle.
Influenced by Shigeyoshi NABESHIMA, the feudal lord of Takeo, he adapted kaimei (enlightenment) policy and in 1834, he founded Igakukan (medical school) in the castle town of Saga-jo Castle.
Influenced by Shigeyoshi NABESHIMA, the feudal lord of Takeo, he adapted kaimei (enlightenment) policy and in 1834, he founded Igakukan (medical school) in the castle town of Saga-jo Castle.

sen.j: （この後好生館と名を変え、今の佐賀県立病院好生館の原型となっている。)
sen.e: (Later the Igakukan changed its name to Koseikan and became a prototype of present Saga prefectural hospital Koseikan.)
(Later the Igakukan changed its name to Koseikan and became a prototype of the present Saga Prefectural hospital Koseikan.)
(Later the Igakukan changed its name to Koseikan and became a prototype of the present Saga Prefectural hospital Koseikan.)

sen.j: 1850年に今の佐賀市に反射炉を建てる。
sen.e: In 1850, he built a reverberating furnace in present Saga City.
sen.cmt: 文はじめにあった「）」を前文に移動しました。
sen.e: In 1850, he built a reverberating furnace in the present Saga City.
In 1850, he built a reverberating furnace in the present Saga City.

sen.j: 明治維新後は議定に就任し大納言の位を受ける。
sen.e: After Meiji Restoration, he was appointed to Gijo (official post) and received a rank of Dainagon (Major Counselor).
After Meiji Restoration, he was appointed Gijo (official post) and received a rank of Dainagon (Major Counselor).
sen.cmt: 文法を修正しました。（appointの語法）
sen.e: After Meiji Restoration, he was appointed Gijo (official post) and received a rank of Dainagon (Major Counselor).

sen.j: 1869年に北海道開拓使長官となるが任地に赴くことなく1871年死去。
sen.e: In 1869, he was appointed to a director of Hokkaido Development Commissioner but he died in 1871 without visiting the place of his appointment.
In 1869, he was appointed a director of Hokkaido Development Commissioner but he died in 1871 without visiting the place of his appointment.
sen.cmt: 文法を修正しました。（appointの語法）
sen.e: In 1869, he was appointed a director of Hokkaido Development Commissioner but he died in 1871 without visiting the place of his appointment.

sen.j: なお案内書に、副島の実兄の枝吉神陽を加えた福岡博『佐賀の幕末維新 八賢伝』（出門堂）がある。
sen.e: There is a handbook by Hiroshi FUKUOKA "Bakumatsu (the last days of Tokugawa Shogunate) Restoration in Saga: The life of eight wise men" (Shutsumondo Publisher), which also included Fukushima's real elder brother Shinyo EDAYOSHI to the wise men.

There is a guidebook about the seven wise men in Saga by Hiroshi FUKUOKA "Bakumatsu (the last days of Tokugawa Shogunate) Restoration in Saga: The life of eight wise men" (Shutsumondo Publisher), which also included descriptions of Fukushima's real elder brother Shinyo EDAYOSHI in addition to those of the seven wise men.

There is a guidebook about the seven wise men in Saga by Hiroshi FUKUOKA "Bakumatsu (the last days of Tokugawa Shogunate) Restoration in Saga: The life of eight wise men" (Shutsumondo Publisher), which also included descriptions of Fukushima's real elder brother Shinyo EDAYOSHI in addition to those of the seven wise men.

sen.j: また同じ出門堂で、龍造寺八幡宮、楠神社編で『枝吉神陽先生遺稿 楠神社御遷座百五十年祭記念出版』がある。
sen.e: Also there is "Literary remains of Shinyo EDAYOSHI sensei (teacher): Publication celebrating 150th Senza-sai Festival (Festival for transfer of a Shinto shrine) of Kusunoki-jinja Shrine", which was a compilation of Ryuzoji Hachiman-gu Shrine and Kusunoki-jinja Shrine, published from the same Shutsumondo Publisher.

Also there is "Literary remains of Shinyo EDAYOSHI sensei (teacher): Publication celebrating 150th Senza-sai Festival (Festival for transfer of a Shinto shrine) of Kusunoki-jinja Shrine", which was a compilation of Ryuzoji Hachiman-gu Shrine and Kusunoki-jinja Shrine, published from the same Shutsumondo Publisher.

Also there is "Literary remains of Shinyo EDAYOSHI sensei (teacher): Publication celebrating 150th Senza-sai Festival (Festival for transfer of a Shinto shrine) of Kusunoki-jinja Shrine", which was a compilation of Ryuzoji Hachiman-gu Shrine and Kusunoki-jinja Shrine, published from the same Shutsumondo Publisher.
